title.narrative: IMPROVED SANITATION & HYGIENE KNOWLEDGE& PRACTICE OF CAREGIVERS AND CHILDREN

description.narrative: Mothers, fathers, caregivers and children in selected districts have increased knowledge and skills to improve sanitation and hygiene behaviour and to demand quality services., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Sanitation. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: New Element

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Mothers, fathers, caregivers and children in selected districts have increased knowledge and skills to improve sanitation and hygiene behaviour and to demand quality services.

description.narrative: The WASH baseline and Knowledge, Attitude and Practice study covered four districts; key findings suggest that less than half the households had access to basic water service level and a quarter households accessed safely managed sanitation service. 435 CLTS trained community motivators have triggered 253 communities resulting in 6,900 additional people gaining access to basic sanitation. 30,047 school children including 14,723 girls reached with knowledge and awareness on improved hygiene and MHM. Klinpela News app developed to share the stories of change from the WASH sector to enable collective learning and inspire individuals and communities to address WASH challenges. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:17/01/2020
